docs.title: Home
docs.text: The GLBB Secure Smart Serial (GS3SFP-232-GE) is a Small Form-factor Pluggable (SFP) console server, purpose-built for serial communication via the TIA-232 (RS-232) standard.

docs.title: Tech Support
docs.text: ✉️ Email: gs3techsupport@glbb.jp

docs.title: Our Company
docs.text:
• Company Name: GLBB Japan K.K.
  • Address: 225-1 Hamagawa, Chatan-cho, Nakagami-gun, Okinawa 904-0112
  • Contact Information: ✉️ gs3techsupport@glbb.jp

docs.title: FAQs
docs.text: 🚧 This page is still under construction. 🚧

docs.title: Features & Capabilities
docs.text:
• Versatile Connectivity The GS3 works with 100Mb, 1Gb, and 10Gb Ethernet SFP/SFP+ ports, offering flexible deployment options to take control of serial ports from an Ethernet network.
  • Converged Management The GS3 is designed to simplify network management by enabling both Ethernet and serial port control through the same switch. With its on-demand TIA-232 (RS-232) model, serial ports can be dynamically added as needed, eliminating the requirement for a separate console management device. This reduces hardware costs and provides a more environmentally friendly solution.
  • Serial Communication via RJ-45 The RJ-45 connector on the GS3 is dedicated solely to serial communication and must not be used for Ethernet connections. While standard straight-through Ethernet cables are supported, only pins 3, 4, 5, and 6 are used for the connection between the GS3 and the managed device. Custom cables are available for interfacing with mini-B and DB9 serial connectors on the target devices.
  • Streamlined IP-Based Serial Management Each GS3 device is assigned a unique IP address, enabling direct IP-based serial communication without the complexity of managing multiple TCP ports. This streamlines serial device management, allowing them to be handled as easily as standard network devices.
  • Enhanced Security and Stability The GS3 provides robust security features, including:
    • Support for up to five locally configured users
    • SSH client access control via Access Control Lists (ACLs)
    • Full compatibility with both IPv4 and IPv6
  • Firmware Upgradeability and User-Friendly Reset The GS3 is firmware-upgradeable via SFTP, ensuring it remains up to date with the latest features and security updates. If the device’s password is forgotten, it can be reset to factory defaults by plugging and unplugging the RJ-45 interface more than four times within ten seconds, providing a simple recovery mechanism.
  • Operational Features The GS3 supports multiple serial baud rates and includes a CR/LF transmit delay to prevent garbled text when copying and pasting into the management interface over SSH.
  • 24/7 Monitoring and Alerts The GS3 enables continuous monitoring of connected devices and can send alerts to Syslog or SNMP servers when specific key phrases or events—such as errors or warm reloads—are detected. This feature enhances network visibility and ensures timely responses to potential issues.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
📝 This is the user guide for the GS3SFP-232-GE.

The commands are separated into these sections:

  • Serial Commands
  • Network Commands
  • Security Management
  • Firmware Commands
  • Serial Phrase Locator Commands

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The firmware commands section provides users with tools to manage and maintain the firmware of the GS3.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the SFTP server and credentials used for the firmware upgrade.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Initiates a firmware upgrade.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Shows the firmware version.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>firmware version
Version: 1.1.11
Compiled on: Jun 18 2025 at 09:14:00
Initial Boot Flag: 42660

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Resets the GS3 to defaults.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The network commands section allows users to configure the network settings for the GS3.

💡 Please note that running the network configuration commands will disconnect all sessions, as the GS3 restarts its network stack.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the hostname.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network hostname GS3
Host name is set to GS3

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the IPv4 settings.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network ipv4 manual
Enter Host Address:
192.168.11.11

Host Address is set to 192.168.11.11
Enter Subnet Mask:
255.255.255.0

Subnet Mask is set to 255.255.255.0
Enter Default Gateway:
192.168.11.1

Default Gateway is set to 192.168.11.1
Enter Primary DNS:
1.1.1.1

Primary DNS is set to 1.1.1.1
Enter Secondary DNS:
8.8.8.8

Secondary DNS is set to 8.8.8.8
All ipv4 configurations are set.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the IPv6 settings.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network ipv6 disable
IPv6 is disabled

[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network show
Compiled: Jun 18 2025 09:14:01

Static IPv4 Address: 192.168.11.11
IPv4 Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
IPv4 Default Gateway: 192.168.11.1
IPv4 Primary DNS: 1.1.1.1
IPv4 Secondary DNS: 8.8.8.8
IPv6 Link-Local Address:
IPv6 Prefix:
IPv6 Prefix Length: 64
IPv6 Global Address:
IPv6 Default Router:
IPv6 Primary DNS:
IPv6 Secondary DNS:
Reverse SSH Port: 2222
Reverse SSH Timeout: 300 seconds
Interface Name: eth0
Hostname: ssh-to-serial
MAC Address: 8C-12-C2-00-00-CE
DHCP: disabled
SLAAC: disabled
Stable Address: disabled
IPv4: enabled
Remote NTP Server: 0.0.0.0
Remote Syslog Server: 0.0.0.0

Current configuration displayed.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the remote NTP server for time synchronization (can be set as either an IP address or a hostname).

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network ntp pool.ntp.org
NTP server is set to pool.ntp.org

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the SSH port.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network port 22
Reverse SSH port is set to 22.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Displays the current network configuration.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network show
Compiled: Jun 18 2025 09:14:01

Static IPv4 Address: 192.168.11.11
IPv4 Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
IPv4 Default Gateway:
IPv4 Primary DNS:
IPv4 Secondary DNS:
IPv6 Link-Local Address: fe80::8e12:c2ff:fe00:ce
IPv6 Global Address: ::
IPv6 Default Router: ::
IPv6 Primary DNS:
IPv6 Secondary DNS:
Reverse SSH Port: 2222
Reverse SSH Timeout: 300 seconds
Interface Name: eth0
Hostname: ssh-to-serial
MAC Address: 8C-12-C2-00-00-CE
DHCP: disabled
SLAAC: enabled
Stable Address: enabled with EUI-64
IPv4: enabled
Remote NTP Server: 0.0.0.0
Remote Syslog Server: 0.0.0.0

Current configuration displayed.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the remote syslog server for logging.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network syslog 192.168.11.12
Syslog server is set to 192.168.11.12

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the SSH timeout duration. The timeout must set to at least 60 seconds, with a range from 60 to 86,400 seconds. The default value is 3,600 seconds.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>network timeout 60
Reverse SSH Timeout is set to 60 seconds.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The security management section allows users to configure the security and management for the GS3.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>session list
Active sessions:
Session ID: 1, User: admin

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>ssh renewkeys eddsa
Renewing SSH keys...

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>user add regular GS3_User password
User GS3_User added successfully.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Changes the password for an existing user account.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>user change GS3_User password
Password for user GS3_User changed successfully.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Deletes the specified user account.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>user delete GS3_User
You are attempting to delete the admin user: GS3_User.
Confirm deletion (attempt 1/3). Type 'y' to confirm, 'n' to abort:
Confirm deletion (attempt 2/3). Type 'y' to confirm, 'n' to abort:
Confirm deletion (attempt 3/3). Type 'y' to confirm, 'n' to abort:
User GS3_User deleted successfully.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Displays a list of all user accounts configured, with their username and roles.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>user list
User 1: admin (admin)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The serial commands section allows users to configure the serial communication settings of the GS3.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the baud rate. The default is set to 115200.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh -to -serial]>serial baudrate 9600
UART Config - Base: 0x4000D000
Clock: 120000000 Hz
Baud: 9600
Data Size: 8
Parity: N
Stop Bits: 1
Flow Control: N
Transmit Delay: 100 ms
Serial baud rate set to 9600.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Establishes a serial connection to the managed device.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the data size, with a range of 5 to 8 bits.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>serial datasize 5
UART Config - Base: 0x4000D000
 Clock: 120000000 Hz
 Baud: 9600
 Data Size: 5
 Parity: N
 Stop Bits: 1
 Flow Control: N
 Transmit Delay: 100 ms
Serial data size set to 5 bits.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the transmit delay, which can be from 0 to 86,400,000.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>serial delay-crlf 300
UART Config - Base: 0x4000D000
 Clock: 120000000 Hz
 Baud: 9600
 Data Size: 5
 Parity: N
 Stop Bits: 1
 Flow Control: N
 Transmit Delay: 300 ms
Transmit delay set to 300 milliseconds.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the key combination used to exit the console session.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>serial exitkey
Press the key you want to use as exit key...

Exit key set to: CTRL+A

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the parity bit to none, odd, or even.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>serial parity odd
UART Config - Base: 0x4000D000
 Clock: 120000000 Hz
 Baud: 115200
 Data Size: 8
 Parity: O
 Stop Bits: 1
 Flow Control: N
 Transmit Delay: 100 ms
Serial parity set to O.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Displays the current serial configuration.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
[admin@ssh-to-serial]>serial show
UART Config - Base：0x4000D000
 Clock：120000000 Hz
 Baud：115200
 Data Size：8
 Parity：N
 Stop Bits：1
 Flow Control：N
 Transmit Delay：0 ms
Current configuration displayed.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Configures the number of stop bits (either 1 or 2).

docs.title: Example
docs.text: [admin@ssh-to-serial]>serial stopbits 1 UART Config - Base: 0x4000D000 Clock: 120000000 Hz Baud: 9600 Data Size: 5 Parity: N Stop Bits: 1 Flow Control: N Transmit Delay: 100 ms Serial stop bits set to 1.S

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This feature monitors the output of the serial console port for specific key phrases.
